volop.name: Food Rescuer - Vineland, Cumberland County, NJ
volop.description:
Our volunteers recover healthy meals from commercial donor cafeterias and deliver them to specified nearby non-profit organizations. Every meal saved nourishes our community in need whilst also reducing the landfill waste and so helping the environment.

The volunteer role would involve:

  • picking up meals from our donor cafeteria, and
  • delivering these meals to our non-profit community partner/s in nearby area.

Each volunteer task will take approximately one hour including travel time between donor and recipient. Pick up from Wallace Middle School, 688 North Mill Road in Vineland, followed by delivery to Vineland Soup Kitchen, 700 East Landis Avenue, Vineland will be on THURSDAYS at 8:00 a.m. and is expected to begin in mid-September 2025.

Volunteers will need to drive their own car. We welcome regular participation but will work with your schedule.

address.full: 120 John Street, PRINCETON, New Jersey, US
688 North Mill Road, Vineland, New Jersey, US

volop.commitmentDetails: Volunteer jobs usually take about 60 minutes but can be slightly more depending on the assignment. We welcome regular participation but will work with your schedule.
volop.otherRequirements: Volunteers will need access to a car, a valid driver's license and adequate auto insurance. They will also need a smartphone and be comfortable lifting and carrying large bags containing several meal trays.
